abstract: With his purchase of four million Dell shares and a lawsuit to halt changes on a shareholder vote on the company’s proposed takeover, Carl C. Icahn is doing his best to shore up a weaker hand.
snippet: With his purchase of four million Dell shares and a lawsuit to halt changes on a shareholder vote on the company’s proposed takeover, Carl C. Icahn is doing his best to shore up a weaker hand.
lead_paragraph: Michael S. Dell has succeeded in changing the voting rules for his proposed takeover of the computer maker that bears his name, bringing him much closer to victory. But his chief nemesis, the billionaire Carl C. Icahn, isn’t giving up.

headline.main: Icahn Bolsters His Assault on Dell, as Odds Mount Against Him

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
